meanings.definition: The act of moving in a circular or spiral motion.
meanings.sent1: The dancer's gyration on the stage was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The gyration of the tornado caused widespread destruction.
meanings.sent3: During the party, Tom's gyration on the dance floor made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The gyration of the planets around the sun is a beautiful cosmic dance.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's flawless gyration earned her a perfect score.

meanings.sent1: The key made a full gyration in the lock before it clicked open.
meanings.sent2: The gyration of the wheel signaled the end of the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat's gyration in chasing its tail was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: With a swift gyration, the gymnast landed perfectly on the mat.
meanings.sent5: The gyration of the compass needle pointed north.
